remarks: Lemma for ~ ovolicc2 .  (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 14-Jun-2014.)
statement:
ovolicc.1 $e |- ( ph -> A e. RR ) $.
ovolicc.2 $e |- ( ph -> B e. RR ) $.
ovolicc.3 $e |- ( ph -> A <_ B ) $.
ovolicc2.4 $e |- S = seq 1 ( + , ( ( abs o. - ) o. F ) ) $.
ovolicc2.5 $e |- ( ph -> F : NN --> ( <_ i^i ( RR X. RR ) ) ) $.
ovolicc2.6 $e |- ( ph -> U e. ( ~P ran ( (,) o. F ) i^i Fin ) ) $.
ovolicc2.7 $e |- ( ph -> ( A [,] B ) C_ U. U ) $.
ovolicc2.8 $e |- ( ph -> G : U --> NN ) $.
ovolicc2.9 $e |- ( ( ph /\ t e. U ) -> ( ( (,) o. F ) ` ( G ` t ) ) = t ) $.
ovolicc2lem1 $p |- ( ( ph /\ X e. U ) -> ( P e. X <-> ( P e. RR /\ ( 1st ` ( F ` ( G ` X ) ) ) < P /\ P < ( 2nd ` ( F ` ( G ` X ) ) ) ) ) ) $.
$d A t $.
$d B t $.
$d F t $.
$d G t $.
$d U t $.
$d X t $.
$d ph t $.
